column2: Pasadena location. I always joked if my significant other didn’t like it, I probably wouldn’t like my her. But really...who doesn’t like steak? Oh right, salad girls. Skirt steak here kicks ass.
Foie-gras stuff. Okay compared to restaurants in Paris. Fun.
More disappointing than Roy Choi's other endeavors.
Crying-tiger beef, and if you want anal fire, jungle curry
Best Thai boat noodles in town.
AYCE pork bellies and yu-chae namul.
When gyros tacos and pizzas get together and have kids…
Get some brunch. Avoid the hiking crowd.
Get the forest of marrow and pickled vegetables and horseradish on the wooden board.
Best Jalisco-style birria, and best Mexican dish in LA.
Ethiopian food and market. Legit. Real.
Can't remember what this was like. Tapas? Funky mix of flavors. Peruvian with Japanese influence.
Great thai food with almost stripperish qualities.
From the owner of Chego and the Kogi truck, Roy Choi. Beer can chicken, furikake kettle corn, thai coconut clam chowda’.
Best AYCE Korean BBQ imo, 7 types of pork belly, excellent service, and I sort of know the waiters...well maybe not anymore.
Ethiopian food. Good stuff, awaze tibbs with injera. Eat with your hands.
Just b/c I love Suzanne Goin’s cooking. Also the owner of The Tavern in Brentwood and The Hungry Cat in Santa Monica, which are...less good (unfortunately).
Get the lamb roulade, if its on the menu.
We all know what they serve here. And at that place next to it as well.
Compton location is better, but...greater chance of getting shot.
Beef noodles with a broth so savory that you’ll want to shit your pants just so you’ll have room for two bowls instead of one.
Deep dish pizza and bread pudding that makes your BRAIN STOP?!
New chinatown location, ooey gooey fries, 12 dolla salad, and one chubby pork belly.
From Jon and Vinny, creators of Animal.
Echo park! Known for its rice-flour-cornbread, and coconut beef, tri-tip, and Filipino influenced food and vibe.
Ramen in Little Osaka; Joon says it’s the best he’s ever had. Dipping ramen experience?
Joon’s best burger. Weaksauce not included.
Xiao long bao better than Din Tai Fung.
Amazing high-quality market and sandwiches. Get the mother's or grandmother's sandwich. (Or something).
Korean-inspired pub tapas. Get some beer too.
Bone marrow, mushroom dishes, bring friends, share food, share friends.
Best burger? Weird, on a roll.
One of LA's best burgers, supposedly.
Foie-gras jelly donut. Amazing? Or GROSS?
Best xiao long bao? Widely debated.
Excellent baby back ribs and beef ribs
Korean porridge. Great when you've got the sniffles.
Wine bar. One of 99 LA essential restaurants
Braised sable-fish stew. Awarded with mangoes and large, overgrown fruit.
Number one LA taco in 2012. Apparently there was a tie.
Best soondubu on the west side.
Also good soondubu, with super banchan.
Try all of dem. All dem tacos in your bellay!
Salted caramel will make you jizz your pants.
Strawberry balsamic, curry, maple nut, salted caramel.
More boba and walking boba organs.
Brown brown bread, strawberry balsamic, vegan options? Really?
“Vintage”, “old-timey,” ice cream hotspot, or retirement home?
Simple, fresh, good pairings, quality is consistent. Earl grey is good.
Pistachio, tea boba, Sicilian almond, salted chocolate...goat milk chocolate?
Owned by a Persian Irishman. That’s pretty sexy. Middle eastern influenced ice cream.
White rose, orange saffron, lavender. Persian ice cream shop, easily mistaken for a unique florist’s spot.
Dark chocolate and pistachio kicks ass.
